name: Salles Hotel Marina Portals

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, not disappointed
reviews.text: We were quite concerned after reading the reviews on this hotel after booking!

reviews.title: Fab 5 day stay
reviews.text: All our concerns soon disappeared on arrival at the hotel. We stayed for 2 weeks 17th - 31st Aug as a family with 2 chidren.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the people!!
reviews.text: The hotel is rated 4* and yes we agree this is a 4* hotel but perhaps not one of the better 4* hotels which we have stayed at. We had a faimily room on the 6th floor, we were pleasantly surprised because it had 2 separate rooms, a twin beded room and a kingsize bedroom and a large bathroom with a fantastic shower. We also had 2 balconies overlooking the sea and pool and also a TV in each bedroom. We stayed half board and the food was nice with a large choice for breakfast and evening meal. The dinning room could get quite hectic at breakfast time especially at weekends, but for some reason at evening meal time, the restaurant was virtuallly empty. There was always plenty of choice and the restaurant staff were very friendy especially Kathrine the waitress from Palma who couldnt speak English but always made so much fuss of us, especially my son.

reviews.title: Dirty nasty three star at best
reviews.text: The pool area was always clean and you could usually get a bed at any time of the day. Yes there was a few mosaic tiles missing around the edge of the pool, but it was kept really clean and there was always a lifeguard on duty.

reviews.title: Great gem of a hotel.
reviews.text: The only disappointing side to the hotel was the entertainment or lack of it! On Mondays and Wednesdays they had a organist and singer, but unfortunately no one seem to support this and it fell very flat!! Outside the hotel there were a only a dozen or so bars/restaurants unless you walked down to the marina (15 mins walk) then there was lots of choice. It was very up market and the yachts were something you would dream about. There was a beach the other side of the marina which was quite small but nice and clean, but this got very packed at the weekend.

reviews.title: No room when we arrived!
reviews.text: Be very careful at this hotel, we arrived here at 1am and was told they had no room for us, the man on reception was very rude and said this happens all the time (very worrying!), he wouldn't even let us use the phone to call our holiday company. We had to go to another hotel about 10 mins away and then come back the next day, when we arrived back at 10am, our room still wasn't ready we had to wait until 12noon, the reason we got a late flight was so we had the whole day to relax and sit in the sun! Best plans never work! They ended up upgrading us to half board for the inconvenience but that would have cost them nothing. The hotel to my standard was not a 4 star, everything was clean etc but very basic. Its in a nice location, a few shops and restaurants outside and about 10 mins walk to the port. Would be nervous about recommending this hotel to families incase the same happened to you, but otherwise the hotel was fine.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: This was our first time staying at this hotel and i would recommend it to anyone, we got a great deal with Alpharooms so much so i was quite worried as to what state the accommodation would be in, i checked out the hotel online and looked quite ok but some of the reviews made me panic because i booked for my 8 friends as well... the hotel is a little dated in the reception area and some of the rooms but what i can say is the hotel is extreamly clean from the reception to the pool to the rooms and the breakfast room, which i think is very important, what dealings i had with staff they were friendly. As for the breakfast i thought it was great, all you can eat buffet it had hot and cold food.. fresh fruit to a fry up (although the spanish sausages were to be desired) fresh pastries to cold meats and from Coffee to Champagne ! it was all there and varied each day, i lapped it up ! We only stayed B&B so i can only comment on Breakfast. There is plenty of sunbeds supplied at the pool and a lifeguard on duty with a nice poolside bar.

reviews.title: great holiday
reviews.text: This hotel was outstanding right from the word go, the service and attitude of the staff was excellent. our room was an excellent size with kingsize bed and beautifully decorated bathroom.

reviews.title: Great Hotel!
reviews.text: The area of portals nous i would recommend to mainly couples although it would be a good base for famillies also.

reviews.title: A Great base for exploring the Island.
reviews.text: There is a bar just round the corner from the hotel called the red bar, when you first step in it has a trendy feel but if you go through to the gardens outside they take you're breath away,at night there are lanterns hung from the over hanging trees which makes for a very romantic evening.The marina itself has plenty to offer in the way of resturants, many of them highly priced but well worth the splurge as the food is wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 3 nights at the hotel Marina Portals.
reviews.title: Good Stay in Marina Portals

likes.disliked: — Some of the corridors are a little dated

reviews.title: Hotel OK for week but no more
reviews.text: We had a family room which was excellent with two large bedrooms (1 double and 1 twin), both with TV and a shared full bathroom. The room was clean, well maintained and they provided plenty of extra pillows, blankets and towels.

reviews.title: Hotel and Staff tired
reviews.text: The staff were all friendly and helpful. We actually did not have a room for the final night as they had no rooms when we originally booked but the reception staff arranged for us to stay in our room for all 3 nights which was great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived just after the mini typhoon and the gardens and pool area had suffered some damage but the staff soon had everything back to normal and our stay was not disrupted at all.
reviews.title: fantastic Marina Portals

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet offered a very wide choice and was open from 730 til 1030 so you didn´t have to rush.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday

likes.liked: — The Hotel was very quiet and not rowdy
likes.disliked: — The food was not as good as we would have liked.

reviews.title: Fab holiday !!
reviews.text: Had a really fab holiday at this great hotel. Went with 8 other women (Aged between 25 - 45 years) Shared rooms (2's and 3's) Plenty of room - clean - food lovely and lots of choice. Barman is John and american and really nice.

reviews.title: Would I return? certainly!!!
reviews.text: Pool all day and drinks all night !! Best places in the evening are places around thge Marina - Drinks 5 Euros. WELLIES is the best bar - sit outside and enjoy the atmosphere - Definitely go again !!!!

reviews.title: Clean Quiet Hotel
reviews.text: We have just returned following a very enjoyable five night stay at this Hotel. We were a little concerned after reading some of the reviews that gave this hotel a poor rating. However we arrived with an open mind. The Hotel was very clean, well presented and well organised, we arrived at 5am and had telephoned in advance to let them know of our late arrival. Everything was ready for us and we were quickly checked into our room by the friendly staff (no bell boys though). The room and bathroom were good with plenty of storage, king size bed, TV wth only the news channel in English. Air con was not very good. Nice balcony with limited views of the Mediteranian and the mountains west facing. Breakfast was buffett style the hot food not to good but the cold selection and fruits were very good.

reviews.title: A little dated
reviews.text: Bottles of bubbly for making a bucks fizz and very attentive staff. The coffee is something I would not recommend, its a vending type machine! The grounds of the hotel are very pleasant with trees shrubs and lawns all well tended and manicured. The pool is great, good depth and large enough for lots of people the temperature is for the hardy (not heated) so its usually free to have a good swim. There are also a couple of childrens pools and a play area for the kids. Table tennis, crazy golf, pool tables and volley ball is all on hand in the grounds. The bar and restaraunt is very good for lunch and drinks throught the day. Outside is a ten min walk to the marina with fantastic yachts, bars, restaraunts, top of the range cars driving in the area and designer shops, great for people watching and chilling out with a drink. Just outside the hotel there are purpose constructed walkways which go for miles, safe for jogging, cycling, roller skating and play areas for children. I think this hotel is a real gem with lots to do nearby. 30 euros taxi from the airport, 1.35 euros to Palma City by bus. Great for families, golfers, and people just wanting a rest in the sun for a few days. We used the courtesy room for shower and changing which is okay. The Gym is not very well equiped. Check out was very good, no suprises or problems with the final account. Would I return? most certainly.

reviews.title: Absolutely Disgusting
reviews.text: Just returned from a 5 day break here with 8 friends.

description: The traditional-style Marina Portals offers stunning Mediterranean Sea views just 7 minutes’ walk from the beach. It has a pool and a spa, and the air-conditioned rooms have satellite TV. Guests have free access to the spa, which has a water circuit, sauna and steam bath, as well as chromotherapy and other relaxation and beauty treatments. Marina Portals also has a large sun terrace with loungers. All the spacious rooms in Marina Portals have a private balcony and free Wi-Fi. They have antique-style furnishings and safes. Many of the rooms have sea views. Marina Portals offers a breakfast and dinner buffet service. The hotel’s snack bar has a terrace, and the Coral Bar offers a range of drinks. Marina Portals is less than 10 minutes’ drive from the capital of Palma de Mallorca. The bars and restaurants of Portals Nous, as well as the marina, are within 10 minutes’ walk.
